name: ineffectively
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that does not produce the effects or results that are wanted: The government is dealing ineffectively with these economic problems. A crack in the plane's wing had been ineffectively repaired. See
ineffective
More examplesFewer examplesThe problem is that the industry is ineffectively regulated.He said law courts are functioning ineffectively in every part of the country.Over the years, diabetes was treated fairly ineffectively with opium, bleeding and starvation diets.
